Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel between flights”
Reviews.Author: Lukhino
Reviews.Content: The location is perfect for travel and ok for tourists. Free shuttle bus from airport, direct public bus to city center - 50 m from hotel. The people in reception were not helpful at all, restaurant is excellent, nice room.

Reviews.Title: “Worst Hotel Ever”
Reviews.Author: JCAE2003
Reviews.Content: The word customer service is not one they know. I have stayed in many hotels over the years and by far this is the worst. They were rude and did not try to accomodate any of our request. The people in reception were not helpful at all. Any questions we might have the answer usually was; we are not able to do that. We asked for a rollaway bed to be add it to our suite instead they move us to a triple room which was way smaller that the room we originally booked.

Reviews.Title: “The worst stay ever”
Reviews.Author: Dorisgaby
Reviews.Content: The location is awful for tourists. Nothing close by had to ride bus to get to food. Their food was not very good, but the worst was their service. The reception was worthless ask for anything and they were dry and curt. We made a mistake in booking the jr suite for our three friends, thinking one of us could sleep on the couch as we had done so many times. Realizing our mistake we asked if we could have a rollaway bed. They were so rude and would not accommodate, when we had been told that it was possible on the phone and then when we went down magically they were gone. They never fixed it, so I went late at night to rest downstairs. You would have thought I broke some law! The concierge was so beyond rude, even as I was complying and leaving he was still shouting at me. I have never been treated so badly.

Reviews.Title: “Only place to stay in Madrid”
Reviews.Author: Tim S
Reviews.Content: Stay there every time i have to go through Madrid, this hotel is an oasis in a very dry dessert! The piano bar is welcoming, the restaurant is excellent and the staff amongst the best in the hotel world.

Reviews.Title: “stayed at this hotel”
Reviews.Author: Maria A
Reviews.Content: Very good hotel, 10 minutes drive from Barajas airport and business distic of madrid. very far from the centre. good breakfast. perfectly clean rooms. and free transfer to the airport.

Reviews.Title: “Another great stay”
Reviews.Author: Doozey
Reviews.Content: The hotel has had alot of work done since staying last year and it's certainly improved the experience. The outside area really is a treat to enjoy the hot Madrid sun and have a relaxing time. Staff were as helpfull as ever and the shuttle bus to the airport was a god send.

Reviews.Title: “Good business hotel close to Madrid airport”
Reviews.Author: EUConsumer
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the hotel several times over the past ten years and have never been disappointed. It offers all the facilities one expects from a business hotel, with pleasant service and at a reasonable price. Moreover, many of the rooms in the central accommodation tower have been refurbished over the past year or so, as has the bar area which is now far more welcoming (although drinks are expensive). The hotel is a taxi ride into the city centre but is well located for the aiport. A shuttle service is provided.

Reviews.Title: “Average hotel”
Reviews.Author: LittleNanna
Reviews.Content: This hotel looks good but to my mind it's only average because of the distance from Madrid centre and it's in an area where there are no restaurants nearby. When walking anywhere (apart from the local (good) park) you have always got a constant stream of traffic to negotiate. Don't have a room on the fifth floor - the windows are up about 6 ft - like skylights - so you have no view of anything, Very clostrophobic. Why doesn't the air con work in March and why does the room safe keep bleeping - so that in the end we had to take the batteries out and not use it!!!???

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel for few nights”
Reviews.Author: AnaPorto
Reviews.Content: I went to this hotel to go to Warner Bros Park and it was a good choice. It is not near the center but it is near the highway to go the park. The hotel is near a quiet residence place. The hotels are big enough to go with 2 children. Very modern and clean and quiet. It is a good Melia with the quality of the trademark. The breakfast very good with quality.

Reviews.Title: “Very good”
Reviews.Author: bagin1981
Reviews.Content: Lived at the hotel from 8 th to August 11, 2011 Excellent new building, a beautiful interior of the hall, bar and restaurant. The hotel has a shuttle bus for delivery to the airport and back. In the lobby there are 2 terminals for the free use of the Internet. Several elevators for different wings of the building. Breakfast is a luxury no exaggeration - there is something for every taste in the most demanding, including several varieties of cheese, ham, hot dogs, scrambled eggs, the most diverse range of pastries, fruits, vegetables, fish, dry wine, service quick and unobtrusive.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: fingleflanger
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a couple of nights. Well presented with a maze of rooms!. The gym is excellent with a good spa (charge). Did not have an evening meal but breakfast was good with plenty of choice. Close to the airport but a long way from the city centre which is a disadvantage if you wish to go there. On one evening we took a taxi which cost around 15 euros one way. The next day we used the metro (about 10 - 15min walk). Our room was on the 5th floor which only had a skylight window. Looking at the structure of the building this is likely to be the case throughout. I wouldn't choose to stay on this floor for that reason. The room was quite small, clean and clinical looking. Large bathroom, not much power to our shower. Perfectly adequate for a short stay or business trip.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, close to the airport; far from the city center”
Reviews.Author: Dimitar I
Reviews.Content: There were several things I like about the hotel and a few I didn't like so much. So here we go with the things that I liked: - Free Wi-Fi around the entire hotel including rooms, lobby, restaurant and conference/meeting rooms. There was at least one network with excellent signal although they had different names so you have to change manually - Food was good, both at breakfast and dinner. There is a "light menu" for dinner with a starter, main course and dessert for €24 - The bed was big and comfortable and sleep was very good - There was a safe in the room - As part of the Melia loyalty program I got the newspaper each morning What i didn't like so much: - Far from the city center, a taxi was around €16 in each direction and there is only a bus stop nearby which is not very convenient if you would like to visit the city - No additional traffic lane for the cars trying to stop in front of the hotel leading to a lot of nervous shouts from other drivers whenever someone stopped to leave a guest Overall a good experience. Till the next one!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent conference venue”
Reviews.Author: TimWoffenden
Reviews.Content: Rooms are spacious and very comfortable: very good showers; the air conditioning works. Food is excellent. Huge choice at breakfast including exceptional fried eggs, pastries, ham, smoked salmon, cheese, fruit - everything you could possibly want! Lunch even better, with paella, langoustines, delicious beef stew, vast array of salads and fruit, and more. Well-equipped conference rooms are all of good size, and, apart from the inevitable hum of the air conditioning, blessed with decent acoustics. The downstairs areas are very pleasant and all over the hotel is typical 'antique' Spanish furniture such as mirrors and beautiful tables to soften the corporate feel. The management is professional and friendly. The reception staff DO speak English perfectly well. There are only two drawbacks: first, it is a 30-45 minutes bus ride into central Madrid (depending on the time of day, although buses are frequent) and a 10 minute walk to the nearest Metro station (Suanzes); second, you cannot rely on the airport shuttle. When I was leaving on a Sunday the shuttle bus left hourly, which was quite inadequate. Many conference participants waited over an hour on arrival at the airport. Free use of the gym was included along with complimentary password-free wi-fi. This hotel has recently been refurbished (to very good effect), and the downstairs areas are also due for an upgrade soon. Might be worth checking if there is work in progress.

Reviews.Title: “Out of town - but a proper fitness centre”
Reviews.Author: MJMChester_UK
Reviews.Content: I often wish people would comment more on the quality of a gym/fitness centre. I like going to the gym and want to know what a hotel has to offer. This hotel has a fantastic gym. Ignore any previous reviews to the contrary - it's big with every weights/cardio option you could want. The Spa looks good. I didn't use it but looked impressive. Hotel is clean, and the rooms were good/ large and best power shower I've ever used. Nice breakfast. So all very good.......apart from one thing - bad location for centre of Madrid. Metro close and the 146 Bus goes straight into town for only €1!!!! But its still a good 20-25 mins to the centre of Madrid. I was happy with it because of the gym. Great location for the airport if you are flying early next day.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel Brillant Value for money”
Reviews.Author: Astonvilla44
Reviews.Content: Me and my girlfriend stopped here for three nights at the end of June and really enjoyed our staff Positives - very well presented and modern.Staff were very helpful and spoke good English. Very good value for money for what I paid (my girlfriend thought I spent a lot more on her which is always a positive!) We turned up at the hotel 4 hours before check in but they let us check in early. Room was spacious and comfortable bed. Negatives - Free transfer from Airport took 40 mins to arrive. Distance to the metro station would be too far for some but we enjoyed the 15 mins walk through the park.

Reviews.Title: “Average Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Trevordg
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this Hotel for four nights as I was attending a conference there. The Hotel is located quite close to the airport. This has the distinct advantage of getting there quickly however the distance to the town center is quite long and one requires a taxi to get there in a comfortable manner and within a respectable time. The Hotel itself is in need of a refurbishment, especially the lifts which rattle and creak all the way up. My room was on the fifth floor )top floor) and the moment I stepped in the room I felt like I was in an oven. I had to leave the AC on for all my stay. The rooms are not that big but they are comfortable. Definitely the fast and free wireless is a great asset. The food is nothing special whilst the prices of the drinks at the Bar are a bit too pricey. One should also note that the gym is good and well equipped.

Reviews.Title: “The good, the bad and the ugly...”
Reviews.Author: DouglasHauser
Reviews.Content: The good: my room was quite nicely decorated. Great free wifi. The bad: no irons available, no adaptors available (to buy or borrow), prehistoric safes in the room with dials on that are hard to operate and don't fit a laptop, terrible American style coffee even when you order 'caffe con leche', very noisy floorboards in the corridor that keep you awake when someone walks past your room. Smelly old rugs all over the hotel - they should just bin them! No tea and coffee making facilities. The ugly: Surly, unhelpful staff on reception, hair knotted around the plug in the bath, used shampoo bottles next to the bath when I first entered the room. Smelly pillow. The spa is closed on Sundays!

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel close to Airport”
Reviews.Author: hosteratu
Reviews.Content: Just enjoyed 4 days at the Melia Avenida America. Not much to say: professional staff, but with few English speakers, which is a bit surprising for a 4 star close to the international Airport... was fun to practice my poor Spanish though. Rooms are comfortable, but why have the only TV by the bed in a suite? A problem was the temperature in the room, which was close to 30 Celsius in the evening with the beautiful spring weather outside. AC was scheduled to be activated in a few weeks so I had all the trouble in the world to convince them to activate it in my room. After advanced negotiations with 4 different persons they finally send someone to press a button in the electric cabinet outside my room... AC was on. Don't expect nice tapas at the bar, they just serve sweaty sandwiches with crisps. Also I was extremely chocked by the pricing of the laundry (I travel every week, so I use hotel laundries all the time)... this was not a service... just robbery!

Reviews.Title: “My Gosh another example of bad taste and poor service from this hotel chain.”
Reviews.Author: MikePM
Reviews.Content: One word of advise, do not even think of booking a night in this horrible hotel (go next door to the Novotel or to the Hitlon Madrid for a safe bet). Bad points: - 1) Silly decoration, KITCH. Full cheap antiquary. 2) Really rude and arrogant front desk staff, bad haircut, broken nails and the usual chewing gum....very elegant indeed. 3) Poorly indicated room allocation, broken and dusty lift. 4) Strong smell of smoke throughout the Bat and living room. 5) Poor and expensive Breakfast selection. 6) ALL the bloody prices are excl. VAT (Obviously you will pay the full price incl. VAT but hey welcome to Sol Melia). 7) Poor selection of newspaper (only the ABC, no need to explain the political view here but hey, for info you are further extreme right than neutral). Good points: + 1) You are not to far from the airport to run away from this....so called hotel. Honestly the best view is from your rear view mirror.

Reviews.Title: “Could be better”
Reviews.Author: Kertesz
Reviews.Content: Reservation was made by the holel's site.We took the recomandation of the site and enroled in MAS a Melia customer programe.The hotel is situated 15 minutes from the airport so is not the best location if you want to visit the city for four days.The hotel provides free shuttel servise from and to the airport.After you arrive at the airport you call them and in 10-15 minutes a mini bus will come to pick you up.Check in was fine although there was no bell boy to help. The room (#154)was fine and big.The main problem was with the toilet which is badly located in the bathroom so you have hardly enough room to sit on it and especially to get up.Another problem was with a bad smell when comming back into the room.It seems that the ventilation in the bathroom works only when the card is in its place(it makes electricity work) Service at the reception was good and helpfull. And now about problems:house keeping-when we check in the room the safe was not working while the door was locked closed.If the safe door is not open the HK should check with maintanance before a guest receives the room. The second day the HK did not bring shampoo bottles and did not fill in the completly empty paper box(at check in there were maibe 3 to 5 pieces of paper left) Next morning we received a newspaper in Spanish ! No use for that -we are not Spanish speaking guests.Never mind-the following mornings no newspaper at all. The room had a LCD tv but only channels in Spanish could be seen.Quite frustrating. There was no emergency map in the room The window was situated behind a desk and almost imposible to open.What a pitty. Breakfast was very good and we had a big choice of items. The worst was the service in the main dining room at breakfast time.The person at the entrance was interested only in the room number and not in welcoming the guests.Not once it happened that I had to ask for bread or tomatoes or other items because the waiters did not take care to refill the missing.You don't have to wait till the plate is empty. The cleaning of the tables was done in a very primitive way ,by cleaning the bread remains directly on the floor.The waiter hold the cups with his finger from the inside of the cup insted holding them from the handle.The coffee pot was another problem.They are brought to your table but they are not always hot since the lid on the pot long time does not close ermeticaly on the pot. Before we left we took a light meal in the lobby.The service was very cold and unprofesional.Not one smile .She never asked if we need something else or if everything is OK.She put our order on the table without sayind a word and never came back not even when we got up to leave. Thank you

Reviews.Title: “Heavy doors slamming from 6am is my lasting memory”
Reviews.Author: BoardmanMijas_Spain
Reviews.Content: Such a shame that my overiding and lasting memory is of the almost unbearable racket of heavy doors slamming 2 or 3 times a minute from 6am presumably as the staff set up breakfast. It is also true that you can hear a lot of corridor noise which woke me at 3am. Fortunately I was only there one night but certainly I could not have stood another night in room 022! The hotel itself (only a few minutes and 9 euro in a cab from the feria ground) looks very smart on arrival and is very tastefully decorated inside. The room was equally impressive when I entered. Very modern, spacious and clean with lots of features. The breakfast buffet offered lots of choice although the "hot" food wasn't. The bar area of the hotel was very comfortable and there was an excellent pianist in the evening which was wonderful. Ideal for relaxation after a hard day at the trade fair with another long day ahead the following day. It entered my subconscious in the bar that the swing doors were heavy and very loud as the weight of them caused them to slam behind you but it didn't stand out so much with the general hubbub and the piano etc. However, at 6am when everything else was quiet, it was absolutely dreadful. Lying there listening to it every few seconds for 2 hours was like Chinese water torture. I faced a very long day, arriving home after a 2.5 hour train ride, at 11pm so I really wasn't best pleased and it has certainly put me off staying in this hotel again. I would have liked to have scored it higher but what value can there be in a hotel room that you can't sleep in!

Reviews.Title: “good hotel for business, not for holiday”
Reviews.Author: suzydior
Reviews.Content: The hotels best feature is that it is in front of a lovely park to walk in and take a break from the roads. It is a good hotel but will not give you an iron or kettle to make a cup of tea or coffee. The nearest shops are 15 minutes walk away for amenities. There is a fridge in the room to stock up with though. Pretty normal business hotel. Functionally good.! You are a long way from the real Madrid. This is purely for business functions.

Reviews.Title: “one of the best hotels”
Reviews.Author: Witchvedma
Reviews.Content: Very nice and convinient hotel! My friends and me celebrated NY in this hotel. It was one of the best hotels I`ve been to. Their breakfasts are wonderful!We liked our rooms a lot too. This hotel was one of a few things that we liked in Madrid

Reviews.Title: “Solid hotel for a week's stay”
Reviews.Author: jsfountain
Reviews.Content: Came here on business and conference at the Feria. Great location as it is just 5 min drive to the expo. Stayed 4 nights. Hotel room was very clean. Comfortable. Everything i needed to feel relaxed. Air conditioning worked great as i like a cool room. Bathroom very spacious and great shower. Bed was perfect; very firm. Had breakfast each morning and it was always so good. buffet style. Everything is always replaced so quickly. Top service. The hotel also has a huge bar area and music at night but i was always out with co workers at dinner until after midnight so i never got to enjoy it. I would recommend this hotel for extended stays or just one night. Bottom line is i was very pleased. A couple of small issues: noise from the hallway is heard in the room. But nothing was heard when i went to bed. Traffic outside is heavy in the mornings and you can hear the cars honking their horns. My toilet made some noises for no apparent reason (like it was backed up). It only did this a couple of times but i found it strange. These were very minor things and really did not bother me. I am attaching pictures of my room.

Reviews.Title: “Nice with few trickies”
Reviews.Author: professional11
Reviews.Content: The airport is very close 10min, we contacted the airport inform disk regarding the hotel shuttle, shuttle arrived in 10 min and has collected us back to the airport at the end of the trip. The hotel mainly for business visits. No shops around, the nearest is 15 min walk, Buses to city center in front of the hotel it takes 45 min to the center and every 15 min. Staff have a very poor English, information and help is intermediate from the staff. No swimming pool, only Spa which is extremely expensive €45 per 40 min per person. Breakfast brilliant, dinner half class, very limited even if you eat one hour after opening the dinner hall. Rooms are very clean, comfortable, very good air-condition in rooms powerful shower

Reviews.Title: “Good modern hotel close to Barajas Airport”
Reviews.Author: EJGMIA
Reviews.Content: I spent one evening here with my spouse on the way back to the US. The rooms are small in nature, but very confortable, and with great mattresses. Noise insulation is not very good and noise comes in from the halls and the rooms above you, you can clearly hears the steps of the guest using the bedroom above you. Whoever located the toilett paper roll inmediately above the toilet bowl ought to go back to hotel design school! Its practically imposible for a regular size person to utilize the toilets without having the toilet roll stuck in your ribs, INCREDIBLE! Someone please start an ergonomics school in Spain, PLEASE!

Reviews.Title: “If you intend to visit Madrid - you better don't make a reservation to thsi hotel”
Reviews.Author: DocSerg
Reviews.Content: I've been to this hotel in Jan 2010 - to a training meeting, so the reservation was not my choice. Never the less - some regards that could be useful for others: - rooms rather clean but you can hear every thing that happens on the corridor as the walls are very thin. - Access to my room was by one single elevator which was not allowing three persons in the same time (for 3 of 4 days) - Breakfast – acceptable If you want to go to the center of the town you have a bus station (end of the line) just across the hotel. It cost 1 euro/trip, it takes 45 min to the other end of the line (just in the center of the town). There is a metro station around, at about 10 min distance but I haven’t tried this. The buss shuttle to the airport is free and came as scheduled. There is no shop around the hotel, so look for anything you want before you get to the hotel. The infrastructure for the training meeting was OK (we were about 100 persons). You can't have breakfast in the room or roomservice in the morning till 7 am! They have spa (40 euro/day and free acces to fitness but the images are missleading showing something that seems to be a pool for swiming - is hot termal water - on pay). Free hotspot and internet acces in the lobby (2 computers of 10 years old so slow that descurage you to use them for more than 10 min).

Reviews.Title: “Ideal for convenience”
Reviews.Author: McDange
Reviews.Content: Ideal location for what I needed which was a hotel near the airport and the Feria de Madrid exhibition centre. Transfers to both were approx 10 - 15 minutes. Room was spacious, clean and comfortable. Rates seemed a bit excessive but this was during a major event nearby. Would not recommend for people wanting to explore the city as it's quite a bit out from the city centre (approx €15 each way in a taxi).

Reviews.Title: “Okay for business - would not be a tourist's choice for a Madrid visit.”
Reviews.Author: dannymcl
Reviews.Content: Stayed here in July 2009. Yes the hotel has that 70s / 80s feel and it has a curious almost museum like feel with lots of old grandfather clocks, paintings, cabinets, cases around the hotel. I would have liked to have known more of the history of each of these pieces - that would make them much more interesting. Despite initial impressions, my room was comfortable and well laid out with a really comfortable bed, good flat screen TV with three English Channels, BBC World, Fox News and CNN plus lots of local channels. Free internet access is a great feature and operates throughout hotel with good signal strength. I particularly liked the small led lights at the desk and on either side of the bed. Also the "daylight" lighting in the bedside tables gives a refreshing light when you wake up. Hotel has different levels with ramps added to steps in attempts to make hotel more disabled friendly. Parking garage on two levels below hotel but chargeable. I negotiated daily price down from 20 Euros to 15 Euros - but still expensive for a hotel out of city centre, Plus point is that there is 24 hour security in car park with CCTV and security in foyer of hotel who make their presence clear - a good security point. Hotel is close to a large el Corte Inglese store which is 1km away - go to roundabout / rotary north of hotel and cross motorway / freeway / autorout and follow main road. There are buses in that direction. No subway / metro close to hotel but did see a station not too far away. My room was a good size with a separat e desk area with good lighting and a table - two seats and a settee / couch in room too. No kettle or coffee machine however and no ironing board or iron which is surprising for a business / conference hotel. Laundry service was however quick and efficient with one day turnaround - but relatively expensive. Good efficient shower and nice bathroom. Air conditioning is efficient, but the fan cuts in and out when you are in the room and it is quite disturbing - I heard at least one guest and one of my colleagues complajing about the noise. Depsite what another reviewer says, my room had lots of power points at desk, beside table and in bathroom - placement well thought out and much better than many hotels where access to power sockets can be quite limited. I count eight in room as I write this review including one above bedside table ideal for charging phone overnight. It looks like some thought has gone into refurb / redesigh of rooms in hotel. There a small fridge / minibar in room too, with space to put your own drinks if necessary.

Reviews.Title: “2 star hotel with 4 star prices”
Reviews.Author: LONDONUK1
Reviews.Content: this is a basic safe neighbourhood 2 star hotel close to the business district and airport but with 4 star prices the downside the rooms were old and the sheets had holes in them. For example no shaver sockets in the bathroom, shower head broken, piano bar menu very limited etc. really quite basic. overall very expensive for what it was. but of course reasonably close to the airport - which can be a benefit for those just passing through the airport. as getting around madrid is difficult. but on value for money even the orange juice in the breakfast buffet (which was really great) would not be enough to make me want to come back.

Reviews.Title: “Conference hotel OK for one-night stay before airport flight”
Reviews.Author: ziggy101Florida
Reviews.Content: This is an acceptable hotel for someone who just needs an overnight stop in Madrid before an airport flight out and who isn't interested (or is too tired) to sightsee. It’s a large, rather gaudy conference hotel that had multiple events going on while we were there. The hotel is about 15 minutes away from the train station by cab, and about 10 minutes from the airport. We tried walking around the area, but there was nothing in the area except a fairly rundown children’s park. Our room was predictable, in the American sense – small, clean, adequately equipped, no charm. We opted for tapas in the piano bar area for dinner rather than the fancy restaurant, but we did have breakfast there – at 17 euros a person. Our whole bill came to 212 euros (inc. tax) for our room and two meals (for two).

Reviews.Title: “Poor service”
Reviews.Author: ESMPortsmouth
Reviews.Content: The free shuttle bus never arrived and we had to pay 30€ for a taxi. Reception staff were not interested and gave no explanations. Answered the phone constantly throughout the whole check in. Room was very noisey and the bed was very very hard. Breakfast and restaraunt were good and tea was hot and strong Would not recommend this hotel

Reviews.Title: “Nice Surprise!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: After several days travel and staying in several different hotels, this was our last night in Spain. The was a great way to leave the country! This hotel is very near the airport, with a free shuttle offered! The rooms are large and very comfortable--we got a great rate on an internet special for only 70 euros! We would definetly stay here again! I would not recommend this hotel for tourist--too far from the center of Madrid.

Reviews.Title: “We had a very pleasant stay!!”
Reviews.Author: LondonWeekender
Reviews.Content: I was quite surprised to read that all the reviews for this hotel were negative. Me and 3 others went for a 5 day trip to Madrid. The hotel is much closer to the airport than it is to the centre of Madrid, but the metro is a 15 minute walk and about another 15 minutes on the metro. So because of this, i guess it isn't the place place to stay for travellers. However, a taxi cost us only 12 euros, and was about a 10 minute drive to the centre, so didn't cost a great deal and we just used this as transport. There is a taxi stand right outside the hotel, which was very useful. The hotel staff helped us with finding things to do around the city, and were very polite. Room service was very quick, however we only ordered beverages. The breakfast was fantastic, everything from cornflakes to egg's to fruit and cakes and biscuits. The rooms were cleaned satisfactorily as well, and the rooms were fantastic as well as the bathroom. The only thing is that if you need to iron your clothes, then bring an iron as the hotel only provides a take away ironing service, and they cannot gurantee when your clothes will be ready!! The hotel also provides airport transport as well, which we weren't aware of. So we got a taxi from the hotel, which cost us around 20 euro's, however on the way back we were informed that hotel transfer to the airport was free, so we took this up!! All in all a very pleasant stay!!

Reviews.Title: “Stay somewhere else.”
Reviews.Author: raiza
Reviews.Content: I have stayed several times in this hotel over the last years. When the hotel opened it was first class, but now it looks shabby. The staff is just not interested in you as a client. You can sit for ever in the bar and nobody pay any attention. Breakfast- cold coffee and cold tea, waitress had holes on her stockings and the uniform was not very clean. Be very careful with the taxidrivers if you arrive at Barajas airport and go to this hotel. They will try to screw you-the extra charge for airport pickup is 4.50 Euros and suitcases free of charge.

Reviews.Title: “poor service, small rooms”
Reviews.Author: gitanocalificado
Reviews.Content: A hotel that looks good but with lousy service. The room was for midgets (we used one of the on line reservations companies). If you open the fridge, just to see what is inside, there is a charge. The safety deposit box did not work. The TV was not working but they manage to repair it as well as the sdb (lack of batteries - the bell said, that clients used to take them home, probable but I was also a client). They were rebuilding the pool just beside the room at 5:30 in the morning. No breakfast included and the price for it was around US20. Every person at a the front desk apologized but no one did a thing. It has been a year and still hurts. I am still waiting for an answer after two written complaints and two by phone. It is not worth the risk. There are other hotels in the price range with good service.

Reviews.Title: “Smoky room”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The hotel room at this hotel that we stayed in was reeking with the smell of smoke. We only paid 75 Euros per night but this was not good value for the money. Cigarette smoke everywhere - even the lobby. Worst hotel I've stayed in on our whole Europe trip. The bathroom was clean, though.

HotelInfo.Name: Melia Avenida America
HotelInfo.Address: Juan Ignacio Luca de Tena 36, 28027 Madrid, Spain
